PhDTitle: Towards Trustworthy Autonomy in Industrial Systems: Agentic Frameworks with Embedded Feedback and Verification
Biography: My name is Javal, and I am an Optimization and Machine Learning Researcher. I work as a Researcher at the Automation Industrial System Lab at Imperial College London under Mehmet Mercangoz. Where, I am working on developing and applying multi-agent AI systems and decision-making frameworks to optimize complex industrial and real-world systems. I completed my Master’s degree from Carnegie Mellon University with a focus on mathematical modeling and optimization. Part of my research, my thesis focused on leverage machine learning methods for getting optimal schedules.

PhDTitle: Integrating artificial intelligence and digital twins to enhance manufacturing and laboratory operations.
Biography: Samuel Stricker, is a Swiss PhD student in Chemical Engineering at Imperial College London in the groups of Mehmet Mercangöz and Antonio Del Rio Chanona, where he investigates the integration of artificial intelligence and digital twins to enhance manufacturing and laboratory operations. He earned a Master of Science in Chemistry from ETH Zurich, focusing on renewable energy technologies, electrochemistry for energy storage and conversion, machine learning, and hybrid modeling. His master’s thesis, supervised by Prof. Dr. G. G. Gosálbez and Dr. A. Butté, addressed optimal design of experiments for bioprocesses using hybrid models. Professionally, Samuel worked as an Algorithm Research Associate at DataHow AG, advancing methods for uncertainty estimation and experimental optimization in bioprocess development.

PhDTitle: Machine Learning for Optimization and Control of Chemical Processes
Biography: I am a first-year PhD student in the Autonomous Industrial Systems Lab. My research focuses on applying Machine Learning for Optimization and Control of Chemical Processes. Prior to joining the lab, I worked as a Research and Development Engineer at ABB, after obtaining my Bachelors and Masters degrees.

PhDTitle: Multi-Agent LLMs for Chemical Lab Management Assistance
Biography: Ammar is a PhD student and part of the Collaborative Computational Modelling at the Interface (CCMI) CDT. His research focuses on the application of multi agent LLMs for chemical lab management assistance with BASF. He graduated from the University of Manchester with a MEng in Chemical Engineering with Industrial Experience.
BachelorsDegree: MEng Chemical Engineering with Industrial Experience
